description: (Universal) Cancels Blender functions without changes
(Universal) Open the toolbox
(Universal) Start or quit edit mode
(Universal) Loads a Blender file, changes the window to a file window
(Universal) Appends parts from other files, or loads as library data
(Universal) Writes a Blender file, changes the window to a file window
(Universal) Exports the scene as a DXF file
(Universal) Exports the scene as a VRML1 file
(Universal) Writes a picture, if a picture has been rendered, and the file format is as indicated in the display buttons
(Universal) Saves a screen dump of the active window
(Universal) Saves a screen dump of the whole Blender screen
(Universal) Displays the logic context
(Universal) Displays the shading context, light, material, or world sub-contexts
(Universal) Displays the shading context and texture sub-context
(Universal) Displays the object context
(Universal) Displays the shading context and world sub-context
(Universal) Displays the editing context
(Universal) Displays the scene context
(Universal) Hides or shows the render window
(Universal) Starts the rendering from the active camera
(Universal) Go to the previous frame
(Universal) Go to the first frame
(Universal) Go to the next frame
(Universal) Go to the last frame
(Universal) Go forward 10 frames
(Universal) Go back 10 frames
(Universal) Change the current Blender window to animation playback mode, the cursor changes to a counter
(Universal) Change the current window and all 3D windows to animation playback mode
(Universal) Insert key menu, this menu differs from window to window
(Universal) Toggle the render buffers
(Universal) Opens the last saved file
(Universal) Quit Blender
(Universal) Timer menu, this menu offers access to information about drawing speed
(Universal) Save user defaults, current project settings are written to the default file that will be loaded every time you start Blender
(Universal) Write file without opening a file window
(Universal) Write videoscape file
(Universal) Erase everything except the render buffer, the default scene is reloaded
(Universal) Redo
(Universal) Undo
(Universal) Redo
(Object Mode) All objects in the visible layer are displayed completely, centered in the window
(Object Mode) Select the next object key, if more than one is selected the selection is shifted up cyclically
(Object Mode) Add to selection the next object key
(Object Mode) Select the previous object key, if more than one is selected the selection is shifted up cyclically
(Object Mode) Adds to selection the previous object key
(Object Mode) Select all layers
(Object Mode) Revert to the previous layer setting
(Object Mode) Start or stop edit mode
(Object Mode) Selects or deselects all
(Object Mode) Apply size and rotation
(Object Mode) If the active object is automatically duplicated, brings up a menu for actually creating the objects
(Object Mode) Brings up the add menu, the toolbox items that start with ADD
(Object Mode) Border select, draws a rectangle with the left mouse to select objects
(Object Mode) Render border, this only works in camera view mode
(Object Mode) Center view, the position of the 3D cursor becomes the new center of the 3D window
(Object Mode) Convert menu, depending on the active object a popup menu is displayed enabling you to convert certain types of ObData
(Object Mode) Copy menu, this menu copies information from the active object to selected objects
(Object Mode) Center zero view, the 3D cursor is set to zero and the view is changed so all objects can be displayed
(Object Mode) Display draw mode menu
(Object Mode) Add duplicate, the selected objects are duplicated
(Object Mode) Add linked duplicate, linked duplicates of the selected objects are created
(Object Mode) Draw the texture image as wire
(Object Mode) Start or stop edit mode
(Object Mode) If selected object is a mash, toggles face select mode on or off
(Object Mode) Sort faces, the faces of the active mesh object are sorted based on the current view in the 3D window
(Object Mode) Grab mode, or translation mode
(Object Mode) Clears translations, given in grab mode
(Object Mode) Group selection
(Object Mode) Insert object key, a keyposition is inserted in the current frame of all selected objects
(Object Mode) Join objects, all selected objects of the same type are added to the active object
(Object Mode) Show keys, the draw key option is turned on for all selected objects
(Object Mode) Display popup menu for showing and selecting all keys
(Object Mode) Makes selected object local, makes library linked objects local for the current scene
(Object Mode) Link selected, links some of the active object data to all selected objects
(Object Mode) Select linked, selected all objects somehow linked to the active object
(Object Mode) Move selected objects to another layer
(Object Mode) Mirror menu, it is possible to mirror an object along the X, Y, or Z axis
(Object Mode) Number panel, the location, rotation, and scaling of the active object are displayed and can be modified
(Object Mode) Clear origin, the origin is erased for all child objects, which causes them to move ot the exact location of the parent objects
(Object Mode) If the selected object is a mesh, toggles the subsurf on or off
(Object Mode) Make selected objects the children of the active object
(Object Mode) Clears parent relation, user is asked if they wish to keep or clear parent-induced transforms
(Object Mode) Rotate mode, works on selected objects
(Object Mode) Clears rotation, the X, Y, and Z rotations of selected objects are set to zero
(Object Mode) Size mode or scaling mode, works on selected objects
(Object Mode) Clears size, the X, Y, and Z dimensions of selected objects are set to 1
(Object Mode) Opens the snap menu
(Object Mode) Texture space mode, the position of dimensions of the texture space for the selected objects can be changed in the same manner for grab and size mode
(Object Mode) Makes selected objects track the active object
(Object Mode) Clears old style track, constraint track is removed as all constrains are
(Object Mode) Makes object single user, the inverse operation of link
(Object Mode) Switches in and out of vertex paint mode
(Object Mode) Object image aspect, this hotkey sets the X and Y dimensions of the selected objects in relation to the dimensions of the image texture they have
(Object Mode) Opens the object booleans menu
(Object Mode) Deletes selected objects
(Object Mode) Toggles solid mode on or off
(Object Mode) Toggles shaded mode on or off
(Object Mode) Toggles textured mode on or off
(Edit Mode - General) Start or stop edit mode
(Edit Mode - General) Start or stop edit mode (alternative)
(Edit Mode - General) Switches between vertex select, edge select, and face select modes
(Edit Mode - General) Select or unselect all
(Edit Mode - General) Circle select
(Edit Mode - General) With vertices selected, this creates a hook object
(Edit Mode - General) Number panel, simpler than the object mode one
(Edit Mode - General) Switch in and out of proportional editing
(Edit Mode - General) Toggles between smooth and sharp proportional editing
(Edit Mode - General) Separate, you can choose to make a new object with all selected vertices, edges, faces, and curves
(Edit Mode - General) Make vertex parent
(Edit Mode - General) Shear, in edit mode this operation enables you to make selected forms slant
(Edit Mode - General) Undo
(Edit Mode - General) Displays specials popup menu
(Edit Mode - General) Warp, selected vertices can be bent into curves with this option
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Adds to selection all vertices connected by an edge to an already selected vertex
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Removes from selection all vertices of the outer ring of selected vertices
(Edit Mode - Mesh) If using curve deformation, toggles the curve cyclic mode on or off
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Extrude selected
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Crease subsurf edge
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Mark LSCM seam
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Make edge or face
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Fill selected, all selected vertices that are bound by edges and form a closed polygon are filled with triangular faces
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Beauty fill, edges of all selected triangular faces are switched so equally sized faces are formed
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Flip faces, selected triangular faces are paired and common edge of each pair swapped
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Hide selected, all selected vertices and faces are hidden
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Hide not selected, all non-selected vertices and faces are hidden
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Reveal, all hidden vertices and faces are drawn again
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Join faces, selected triangular faces are joined in pairs and transformed to quads
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Knife tool menu
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Select linked
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Deselect linked
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Select linked selected
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Mirror, opens a popup asking for the axis to mirror
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Merges selected vertices as barycentrum or at cursor depending on selection made on popup
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Calculate normals outside
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Calculate normals inside
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Scales each vertex in the direction of its local normal
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Make triangles, all selected faces are converted to triangles
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Undo
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Redo
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Undo menu
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Special menu
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Erase selected
(Edit Mode - Mesh) Split, this command splits the selected part of a mesh without deleting faces
(Edit Mode - Curve) Set the selected curves to cyclic or turn cyclic off
(Edit Mode - Curve) Extrude curve
(Edit Mode - Curve) Add segment, a segment is added between two selected vertices at the end of two curves
(Edit Mode - Curve) Toggle handle align or free
(Edit Mode - Curve) Set handle to auto
(Edit Mode - Curve) Calculate handles
(Edit Mode - Curve) Select linked
(Edit Mode - Curve) Deselect linked
(Edit Mode - Curve) Mirror selected control points exactly as for vertices in a mesh
(Edit Mode - Curve) Tilt mode, specify an extra axis rotation for each vertex in a 3D curve
(Edit Mode - Curve) Clear tilt
(Edit Mode - Curve) Vector handle
(Edit Mode - Curve) The special menu for curves appears
(Edit Mode - Curve) Erase selected
(Edit Mode - Surface) Toggle cyclic menu
(Edit Mode - Surface) Extrude selected
(Edit Mode - Surface) Add segment, a segment is added between two selected vertices at the end of two curves
(Edit Mode - Surface) Select linked
(Edit Mode - Surface) Deselect linked
(Edit Mode - Surface) Mirror selected control points exactly as for vertices in a mesh
(Edit Mode - Surface) Select row, starting with the last selected vertex
(Edit Mode - Surface) The special menu for surfaces appears
(Edit Mode - Surface) Erase selected
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor one position forward
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor to the end of the line
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor one position backwards
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor to the start of the line
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor one line forward
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor to the end of the text
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor one line back
(Edit Mode - Font) Move text cursor to the beginning of the text
(Edit Mode - Font) Reload original data
(Edit Mode - Font) Paste text
(VertexPaint) All vertex colors are erased, they are changed to the current drawing color
(VertexPaint) Undo, press twice redos the undone
(VertexPaint) Shared vertexcol, the colors of all faces that share vertices are blended
(UV Editor) LSCM unwrapping, launches on the faces visible in the UV editor
(UV Editor) Pin selected vertices, they will stay in place on the UV editor when executing an LSCM unwrap
(UV Editor) Un-pin selected vertices
(FaceSelect) Switches to edit mode
(FaceSelect) With multiple, co-planar faces selected, this will merge them into one FGon so long as they remain co-planar
(FaceSelect) Select linked UVs
(FaceSelect) Calls a menu allowing to rotate the UV coordinates or the vertex col
(FaceSelect) Calls the UV Calculation menu
